name: Rectosigmoid Junction Intussusception with Ischemic Necrosis
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain and bloody stools for the past 12 hours
symptoms: inability to pass gas or stool
physical_findings: palpable sausage-shaped mass in left lower quadrant
treatment: emergency surgical reduction with possible resection
prognosis: Guarded - dependent on timing of intervention and extent of necrosis
description: A rare form of adult intussusception where the sigmoid colon telescopes into the rectum, causing vascular compromise and early ischemic changes. Unlike pediatric cases, adult intussusception typically has a lead point (often neoplastic in origin). This variant involves the rectosigmoid junction specifically, creating diagnostic challenges as it may mimic diverticulitis or obstructing malignancy.
